intro: Appendicula effusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Appendicula effusa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
